title: The 'KD' effect: More and more elite 7-footers want to be...
text:
Chet Holmgren found himself face-to-face with his wildest dream back in August. As he got the ball on the wing in a scrimmage at Steph Curry’s select camp, his defender was the namesake Golden State Warriors superstar. The 17-year-old knew exactly what to do.



“I saw him,” he’d tell his grassroots coach later, “and I had to hit him.”



Holmgren broke out Curry’s signature shuffle move. He added two behind-the-back dribbles as Curry reached in for the steal. Holmgren then drove the baseline and sailed in for a dunk before falling to the floor, hoots and hollers from onlookers softening his landing.



Within an hour, the play went viral. People noticed not just because Curry had gotten roasted with his own move by a high schooler. They also had to do a double-take because Holmgren is 7 feet tall.



It was a stunning display of ball-handling and quickness for a kid that size. If you’ve followed Holmgren’s youth games or watched his internet...
description: Top prospects are resisting the idea they have to stay inside the post, and want to shoot 3s and handle the ball.
